page.title: 20ATTITUDES, DEEPCAR/WORTLEY
page.content: Many families have lived in these areas for generations. Despite its expansion,{Deepcar}still maintains its village identity. There is an insular, parochial and aloof attitude towards{Sheffield,}only 8 miles away. People in{Stocksbridge,}1 mile away, generally regard Deepcar as having an air of superiority. New inhabitants ('comers-in') are accepted slowly but relationships once formed are firm, sincere ones. A survey of the estate (88 people) showed 64% adults not born in Deepcar and 84% have lived there for less than 20 yrs. The{Wharncliffe}farming community similarly is a closely-knit one centred on{Wortley.}The Wharncliffe Estate is still influential. {THIS PROJECT WAS COMPILED BY {CHILDREN, STAFF, PARENTS AND FRIENDS {OF DEEPCAR ST.JOHN'S C.E.
